intro: Scleroptychis, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It consists of several species, primarily native to Africa, particularly in arid and semi-arid regions. The plants are shrubs or small trees, often characterized by their spiny stems and small, clustered leaves. They produce yellowish or greenish flowers, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Scleroptychis species are adapted to harsh environments, showcasing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
